reviews.sentence: Kanapali beauty. If you get a balcony room with a view the suites you will have a wonderful room with a great vantage point. The hotel is dated but still very clean and well kept especially the grounds. Also location is excellent with walkable path all along the beach and light shopping and cafes close by.

Amazing. This resort is in a perfect location. Black rock is very fun the jump off of and the snorkeling around black rock is spectacular. We saw many fish and sea turtles. The pool on the resort is beautiful and extremely relaxing. Overall this resort is perfect for families.

Wonderful location and snorkeling beach. We spent 3 days here after a week in a condo. While the space was obviously much smaller we really enjoyed our stay. Great location with Black Rock Beach for snorkeling right in front of the hotel and Whalers Village just a 5 10 minute walk. Room was nice and the service staff great.

Great location lots to do. This hotel is in a great location on Kanapali Beach. We enrolled in Starwod Preferred prior to booking our reservation for an oceanfront view room. When we arrived we were immediately upgraded to a deluxe oceanfront view room with a wet bar huge bathroom and lanai overlooking the ocean. There is so much to do at this hotel you really never need to leave of course we did do the Road to Hana and Lahaina. A little piece of paradise.
Mediocre for the money. Beautiful grounds and good location. Rooms had great ocean views. Hotel configuration very confusing to navigate. Staff unfriendly and seemed tired. Pricey food and drinks.

A nice surprise. We were very pleasantly surprised with this resort. In need of a relaxing week it did not disappoint The weather was perfect and the resort had everything we needed. The breakfast which was included for us was a very good buffet and the staff courteous and friendly. Our partial ocean view room was well appointed but could do with some upgrading. The King bed was very comfortable. The resort itself is In a perfect position alongside black rock and the beach stunning. So many activities are offered but we took the chance to just chill out. The 2 little beachside bars are perfect for cocktails or a simple lunch or dinner. There was live music there at night. Tepanyaki Dan is the best restaurant. For supplies. Whalers village is just a few minutes walk and the ABC shop there sells most things you need. We actually bought beach chairs for around 20 each instead of paying 50 a day for beach lounges. We took a day trip to Lahaina on the free shuttle. This is a gorgeous little fishing village and we ate at Lahaina Fish Co Right on the water. Would recommend. There are outlet stores close by as well. Overall this holiday was a great experience. Maui is stunning.

Fabulous Stay Dinner Under the Stars was the Highlight. My wife and recently spent 7 nights at the Sheraton Maui Resort and Spa. This was our second visit to the property which we first visited in 2013. As one of the first resorts built in Kanapali the resort enjoys both a spacious feel and a great location at the midpoint of the Kanapali beach walk one of the many benefits of a planned resort community. As was the case on our first stay we had a room in building 4 with a stunning view over the grounds pool and down the beach. The room was clean quiet and very comfortable. Having a private lanai to enjoy breakfast or the sunset made it one of the best resort rooms we have ever had. The highlight of our stay was ‘ Dinning Under the Stars ’ to celebrate my wife ’s birthday. The meal was incredible 5 courses all spectacular I would however suggest eating very little beforehand. As great as the food and service were what really made it stand out was the setting. A private cabana looking over the beach and Black Rock. Planning a special dinner event from afar can sometimes be complicated. From the moment we chose a return visit to the Sheraton Maui and arranged our Dinner Under the Stars we received amazing service. Rory Cosma Guest Service Manager not only made sure that all details for our dinner were perfect but went above and beyond on several occasions. For instance he was kind enough to stop and buy a lei for my wife on his way to work after I inquired about purchasing one at the hotel. Rory made sure that all our requests were met and that we received all our platinum SPG benefits. He is an outstanding member of the Sheraton Maui team.

You can watch the whales from the beach. My husband and I went to Maui for our honeymoon in Feb. The hotel was beautiful and very peaceful. Each night they have Hawaiian dancers and light all the gas lamps around the grounds. The beach bar is the perfect location to watch whilst sipping a cocktail out of a coconut. We arrived at night and when we woke up the following morning we opened the curtains to see whales jumping in the sea. They were so close it was incredible. You can even hear them if you put your head under the waterThere are a few restaurants and shops close by. They all seem to close at around 11 pm which was fine by us as meant it was nice and quiet in the evenings. A couple of nights we took a short bus ride from the hotel to the town where there are more places to eat and a few more shops. We absolutely fell in love with Maui and The Sheraton definitely lived up to it is name. Incredible holiday.

The price is right. Dreamtrips offered 5 nights 6 days for a very reasonable priced ocean view room with breakfast brunch 7 to 11 am plus welcome drinks and an island tour. beautiful hotel setting with great pool and beach public beach activity center cliff divers bar pricey as everything in Hawaii. 8 minute beach walk to shopping and restaurants. snorkeling just steps from the beach. tranquil and quiet if the dont prepare a major event. Tmobile team blocked pool in the afternoon for private function. parking additional high fee. but recommended meutermedia.

Wonderful second honeymoon. Since my daughter had a school trip on the Big Island with her class my wife and I decided to go to the Sheraton Maui for a nice weekend getaway. The property is huge and if you have not been there before it is easy to get lost. They gave us a nice Ocean view room right on Black Rock view attached. We had buffet breakfast every morning lucky it was comped since it is 40 a head. but service was wonderful. The pool was perfect as well but you have to hit the beach pics included. Lots to see when you snorkel. The mini cabanas by the pool for some reason is cheaper than getting 2 chairs and an umbrella beachside. The pool was not too cold and what I love about the property is that even when full it does not seem too crowded. The exercise room was ok but needs newer equipment. Lots of cardio vs weights. The tepanyaki restaurant is an absolute gem and good value for the price. Always fun to meet other travelers. Checkout is what prevents our stay from being higher no TV checkout and only 1 person doing checkout. RealyHousekeping is solid and the aloha shown by staff is infectious. Will definitely come backPs if you have Kamaina discount be sure to use it.

THE place to stay on Maui. Ignore the negative reviews if you can book an ocean front room in building 6. Newly remodeled quiet stunning view with its own gated parking right outside the building. Yes it ’s a 5 10min walk to the beach. But this is a huge resort chances are you have to walk to beach anyway. Location1 on Kanapali beach. Especially if you to snorkle and swim with turtles everyday. Black rock area is home to several turtles we can see them throughout the day everyday. Debated between Sheraton and Hyat so glad we chose Sheraton. There is no comparison when it comes to the convenience to snorkel by the Black Rock. PolSize is decent plenty of pool chairs. Cabana rental is 60 day do get there by 8 am to reserve. The gift shop has Maui Vera blue tube. We were advised to keep it in the mini refrigerator in the room and apply after swim or snorkel it is very soothing. Breakfast. Buffet is decent with many optionsThere is a Starbucks coffee stand on the left side of the breakfast check inPol barMai Tai bar has decent options for lunchClif dive bar is a great spot to watch the daily sunset torch lightening ceremony. They are not meant to be your fine dining restaurants but for onsite convenience more than adequateServiceThey are the best. I got stung by baby jelly fish. Not knowing caused the rashes at first I was worried it was bed bug. The front desk manager took this seriously sent hotel staff to check my room thoroughly and they called professional pest control company to check our room again the next day to make sure it was clean it was clean indeed. Once we realized the rash was from jelly fish sting they called security guard and he came in immediately with vinegar spray bottle. They also provided nearby urgent care doctor locations and recommended the one by the Times Market due to its co localization with a pharmacy. Being stung by jelly fish was no fun but the hotel staff was so helpful. Housekeeping was always timely. We usually walked into our tidy room after we returned from breakfast everydaySPG Platinum Elite perks 2 free breakfast buffet passes per room everyday. free parking free upgraded high speed internetLocal restaurants Monkeypod Kitchen at Whaler village has decent fod Roy ’s is very close by just like other island ’s typical Hawaiian fod Lahaina Grill need reservation months ahead with credit card Fletwod ’s has very nice rooftop dining patio with nice view Japengo at the Hyat a mile down the beach offers nice sushi and other fusion fodFre shuttle to LahainaVery convenient if you do not want to search for parking yourself. Take Route 2 to Lahaina downtown. Three stops 1st stop at Safeway 2nd stop at the outlet mall 3rd stop at the back of the shops by the banyan tree. Take your room key as the driver would ask for it when he picked you up from Lahaina. Shuttle station is under the stairs in front of the lobby you will see people waiting thereDriving around the islandNorth island the road has a long stretch one lane road with many blind turns. Iao Valley is nice but you might be better off going from southThe road to Hana best stop is at Nahiku just before reaching Hana. Beautiful view with swimming hole that is not crowded and you can actually jump in to swimMaui PieMade the trip to Kihei for Maui Pie the chocolate haupia pie is worth the extra drive.

Good. but I have had better for less. I stayed at Sheraton Maui with my fiancee husband on our elopement honeymoon getaway. Sheraton Maui is a great location nicely landscaped on a beautiful beach and it is just a short gorgeous walk to Whalers Village for shopping and dining we enjoyed this convenience many times during our stay. This review will seem a little harsh compared to the four stars I gave. that is because its a great resort however I could not help but compare it to the resort that I stayed at last time I was in Maui which is why I have a few more negative comments I would had I never been to Maui before. The newly remodeled rooms were nice but a little bare as if they had forgotten a to hang up the last few pieces of art. House keeping was good although a little inconsistent with towels sometimes not replacing any hand towels or wash cloths. We stayed in an ocean front room in a great location with an amazing view however the rail on the lanai is thick and can block the gorgeous view if you do not position yourself strategically. Kanapali beach is a great beach and we loved the convenience of having snorkeling on site. We ate at Mai Tai Bar Cliff Rock and Rock Salt 2x. I enjoyed both meals at Rock Salt but I found Mai Tai Bar and Cliff Rock to be over priced and under whelming. The gym is nice and well equipped however I was disappointed that there were no exercise classes offered. I loved the convenience of the on site Black Rock Spa and I booked a few services there. I had a great massage worth it and a mediocre mani pedi definitely not worth the price on two different days with different aestheticians. My fiancee commented that even he could have done a better job on my nails. The spa has a nice atmosphere and some of the rooms have openings to the outside so you do not feel too closed off from the beautiful Maui atmosphere. Beware of the Aloha Welcome. We thought that this would be an information session on the large resort. Not so. They just try to sell you a a tour and or time share of other nearby Sheraton resorts. I have only been to Maui one other time and I stayed at the Royal Lahaina. It costs about 150 less per night the rooms are nicer the property is nicer and the beach is quieter. My then fiancee stayed there the night before we got married and I was pleased to find out that they still offer free yoga classes first thing in the morning on Mondays and Fridays. I chose Sheraton Maui because I wanted to try something different. Maui is paradise and Kanapali beach is bar none. I had a great time but I will stay at the Royal Lahaina on my next visit to Maui.

Kapalani Beach site with Four Star Hotel. Wonderful beach for swimming snorkeling walking. whale watching on catamaran 100 yards away. Property is beautifully landscaped flowers trees koi ponds child friendly pools and slides. Rooms are big recently renovated decor and bathrooms. Large outdoor areas of bars and restaurants. All rooms have ocean facing balconies.

They have free reef safe sun block near the beach but that is about the only good thing I can say for it. Shady miscellaneous charges are added to your bill once you arrive. The hotel grounds and room are nothing to write home about. The prices are too high. Breakfast is 40 but I have had way better breakfast for free at a Drury Inn. Oh also I will give a 1 because they had a beyond burger at the beach bar. Of course the beach is beautiful but Sheraton has nothing to do with the natural beauty of Hawaii. Go somewhere else. I expect better from Sheraton and way better from any place that lists their rooms at 60 night plus adds extra fees once you show up. Go up the beach somewhere else.

They have free reef safe sun block near the beach but that is about the only good thing I can say for it. Shady miscellaneous charges are added to your bill once you arrive. The hotel grounds and room are nothing to write home about. The prices are too high. Breakfast is 40 but I have had way better breakfast for free at a Drury Inn. Oh also I will give a 1 because they had a beyond burger at the beach bar. Of course the beach is beautiful but Sheraton has nothing to do with the natural beauty of Hawaii. Go somewhere else. I expect better from Sheraton and way better from any place that lists their rooms at 60 night plus adds extra fees once you show up. Go up the beach somewhere else.

Beautiful Beach. Spend 8 nights at Sheraton Maui. Valet and front desk Joane were great with very little wait time at check in. Stayed in building 2 on top floor. Great view of beach ocean and resort. Ate breakfeast buffet every morning which had good selection and good order any syle of egg. Black Rock is great for snorkeling it is a bit crowded with folks coming from other resorts. The beach was a bit limited this time due to erosion from high surf. Shertaon has two pools connected by a waterway. Need to arrive early to get lounge close to pool. Food service at pool was mostly pretty good. They have two pool cafes which serve drinks and food. They also have a hotdog standHanks. Really good hotdogs. Hotel is easy walking to Whalers Village lots of shopping and food choices. Rooms were clean and maintained daily. If you are looking for a really quiet resort to relax it may not be you best bet its gets lots of traffic from other resorts along beach walk and can feel crowded at time. There was a conference the week we were there and the conference folks came in droves to pool and bars. This was our 5 visit to Sheratom MAui and I would recomend it for location views service and closeness to other activities.

Disappointed. The hotel was ok and the room was clean. the food was really bad. Guy Fieri ’s face was on the wall of the haut dog place and I ’m pretty sure he would not approve of the brats that are not grilled boiled and cold. The mixed drinks were poorly made the mai tai was gross. The beach was nice but very busy since it ’s public. We will not be returning.
Can not get closer to the beach and some great snorkeling spots. It was somewhat cumbersome to navigate from my building 6 to the amenities walk through 2 buildings and ride 3 elevators.

Great week at the Sheraton Maui. The Sheraton Maui is a comfortable well maintained resort. The hotel is older but the rooms bathrooms have been updated and were very clean. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet each day and all of the staff we interacted with were very pleasant. The grounds are beautiful with plenty of walkways and access to the pool and beach with a great snorkeling area. We even saw some sea turtles from the beach. The ocean was relatively calm in this area. The beach has eroded due to the storms over the winter so there is n’t much room to sit on the beach at high tide. Also the beach is public so the hotel does n’t have chairs service on the beach which seems to be the case in all of Maui. The pool area was very comfortable but the umbrellas are limited so on busy days it ’s best to get your seats early if you want shade. You can also pay for a cabana or a double chaise lounge with a shade. We had lunch and drinks at the pool restaurant and everything was very good. The hotel also has access to the beach walkway that will take you to all the other resorts and Whaler ’s Village down the road. Whaler ’s Village is about a 10 minute walk and has restaurants and shops. The town of Lahaina is a 10 minute drive and is worth going to for shopping and restaurants. This hotel is in a great location and was very convenient for our family ’s needs. Overall we had a great time at this hotel and felt that it is solidly a 4 star hotel. Many of the reviews I read before going were critical but we did n’t encounter any issues at this hotel. The only disappointment was that the luau was already sold out for the week of our stay so I ’d advise anyone who wants to go to get your tickets early.

There could be better hotels 有其他更好的酒店 Maui Island is one of the famous vacation Island. We believe Sheraton would be one of the greatest hotel there and stayed for 2nights. The area of Sheraton Maui is big and it takes me 10mins walk from reception to my room. The lobby is elegant. I booked ocean view room 1night under my name and garden view room another night under my wife name. I double confirmed with the reception we could stay at the same room during our stay. After check in we did n’t get any direction any reception and have to find the room ourselves and it is difficult to find without any information. Also we did n’t get any information about any activity in resort as there is resort fee charged. Afterwards my room is unfortunately at second floor and that means the view is mainly garden. The room is standard as normal hotel no surprise. Breakfast is USD32 but just a few choices. The worst thing is that I can not enter my room after have my time at beach. The reason behind is that they failed to enter our continuous nights into system. Could you imagine if you are all wet and can not go into the room and have to walk 10mins to lobby. The feeling is terrible and I did contact the hotel later. The manager reply with feedback. I just want them to make it sure in order to avoid others suffer like us. No bottle of water in room but just a few water machine in resort. Beach is awesome and sunset is amazing茂宜島是著名的度假島之一。我們相信喜來登酒店將成為那裡最好的酒店之一並入住2晚。茂宜島喜來登酒店面積很大，從接待處步行10分鐘到我的房間。大堂優雅。我用我的名字預訂了一個晚上的花園景觀房間及用我妻子的名字預訂了海景房1晚。我在接待處雙重確認後，我們可以在住宿期間住在同一個房間。CHECK IN後，我們沒有得到任何接收方向，我們必須自己找到房間，沒有任何信息是很難找到。此外，收取了度假村費用，但我們沒有獲得任何有關度假村活動的信息。之後，我的房間不幸在二樓，這意味著視線主要是花園。房間是標準的普通酒店，毫不奇怪。早餐是32美元，但早餐選擇不多。最糟糕的是我在海灘度過後無法進入房間。背後的原因是他們沒有輸入我們連續住宿兩晚進入系統。你能想像如果你都濕了，不能進入房間，必須步行10分鐘去遊說嗎？感覺很糟糕，我之後聯繫了酒店。經理回復反饋。我只是希望他們確保以避免其他人像我們一樣受苦。房間裡沒有一瓶水，但度假村只有幾台水機。海灘很棒，日落很棒 。.

Amazing location but get ready to pay for everything. Second time staying at this hotel last time was three years ago. it is a beautiful location with the best beach snorkeling in Kanapali but you pay a premium for that. I would rate the location a 5 but the overall 3 rating is based on the total experience. Total nightly charges we paid for ocean view in July the off season with AAA discout were 34 for room 14 room tax 34 state tax 29 resort fee charge and 23 for self parking each night. The resort charge and parking fee are ridiculous. I wish Sheraton would just build it into their prices even if this sort of practice has become more prevalent. The resort charge covers wi fi okay I get many other hotels charge for this too but also pool floats the shuttle to Lahaina and other things that should simply be included in the price if you ask me. Food is expensive here too feeding a family of four for dinner will run you 200 without alcohol unles you eat the simpler food by the pool then expect to pay around 100 again without alcohol. You are better off eating in Lahaina every night which is more fun anyway. What really disappointed me is how the pool is managed now which changed since our last visit 3 years ago. While there were a few cabanas for rent previously I would say roughly 14 of the seats by the pool are now only usable if you purchase them. These are covered spots that range anywhere from 55 per day two seats with retractable cover up to 200 per day cabana with little TV that 4 can use comfortably. I was really disappointed to see the increase in these covered spots that require you to pay for them. I realize this is a growing trend saw a lot of that in Vegas too but it is a fleecing for sure. Of course you can get up at 6 am and run down and put your towels out and get one of the free covered spots with umbrellas but we all know what a hassle that it and 12 of those formerly free covered spots are now gone because of the paid spots. My last complaint we reserved an ocean view but upon arrival were told that none were available so they were going to upgrade us to oceanfront usually at other locations I prefer oceanfront but not here because the oceanview rooms are closer to the pool. Unfortunately it was on the ground floor only room available we were told and there is a 5 foot hedge that impedes your view of the ocean unles you walk over to it and stand next to it might as well have been a garden view. Fortunately we pushed and were able to move to an ocean view the next day when one became available. Okay I am done complaining. on to the good stuff. The location is fantastic right on black rock where you have some of the best beach snorkeling in the Kanapali region. Not only is the beach wider here than others on the the same stretch but the water is typically calmer and you will see lots of fish by black rock. We also saw at least one turtle every day swimming very close to shore you can usually tell when a turtle is nearby because of the people that crowd around it in the water. The facilities have a very nice retro but modern vibe I believe built in the 60s. my parents met here. that still holds up today and has been nicely updated in the interior. The kids really enjoyed the pool too it has a form of lazy river in shape only the water does not move that you can float around in with the beanbag floats oh and I saw the floats referenced online as part of the resort fee is not that crazy. Sorry I know I said I was done complaining. The room was comfortable and modern. not sure what more to say. it is a room. The food while expensive was great and I could not get enough of the polside fish tacos or spicy Ahi poke bowl. In summary beautiful location but you pay for it. My review might seem a little harsh but having been here before I was just a little disappointed to find some of the changes that occurred especially by the pool. Know before you go.

Just got here yesterday. The pool area ran out of towels. Was told to come back in 10 minutes. When I returned to get my beach towel they still had none. The girl gave me attitude and said it is not her fault because laundry is off site. Seems to me they should have better logistical planning to take care of their guests.

Lovely stay. We stayed here on the last night of our honeymoon and quite enjoyed the space. The one downside is that we did not have a patio while most other rooms every room facing the ocean did. but we did have a partial ocean view which was great. There is a shuttle to take you to the shops nearby or to the town of Lahaina which is about 15 minutes down the road. The staff were lovely and so were the pools gym etc. it is unfortunate that even guests do not get an hour of free rental for beach rentals as we have found this with most other of the higher resorts but oh well. Snorkeling right off of the shoreline is fabulous and there are tons of fish to see. the current is strong so make sure you are a decent swimmer before heading out.

I wish I had never booked this hotel. We chose this hotel for the week of our wedding and I regret our choice. I do n’t expect special treatment but of anytime in my life I would like to feel looked after by the hotel I chose for the week of my wedding. Unfortunately this hotel was a very bad choice. Even from check in I could sense the type of stay we were about to experience. The very first night we checked in we found 2 cockroaches in our room and even worse our bed. Nightmare start. It took 15 hours to move us to another room as staff were very slow in making this move happen. Everytime myself or my partner went to reception there was nobody there. Absolutely crazy for a property of this size. There were occasions where staff were in the back chatting and it was not their priority to come and assist guests. The sea was very dangerous and rough by this hotel and we found it quite scary the lack of lifeguards or signs or announcements. I would not have had a child at the beach here. In the lead up to the wedding we tried to book the dining under the stars again this was a very arduous process and I was n’t getting responses so we chose somewhere else. The day of my wedding I had an issue with my dress steamer. I rang for any help that might be offered. Absolutely no help. In general you do not feel looked after at this hotel and certainly not as bride groom that ’s for sure.

I would have given 1 star but due to location the hotel is in I could n’t just give one star only. The pros the location is really nice very convenient area with downtown Lahaina being only minutes away. Cons the hotel itself we stayed here in 2017 and had an awesome experience. We upgraded our room to the “ ocean front room ” it was located really close to the beach. When we booked this time we booked “ ocean view ” not realizing all the technicalities of each room. We walked down to our room which was on the ground floor the key did n’t work. After a day of travel you ’re a little exhausted and just want to relax for a second but we had to trek our way back up to the front desk to get another key we head back down we get into the room and start to unpack and a roach comes running out of the closet. My husband immediately called the front desk and they switched our room to I guess what is considered “ ocean front ”. it ’s on the other side of the hotel it takes forever to get to the pool or beach which is a little annoying. We have n’t checked out yet but I keep seeing these 100 charges to my credit card and I ’m hoping they are charging us for the relocation for the roaches being in our initial room. Also if you booked recently you may want to call apparently they are doing construction to the hotel which is pretty loud when sitting at the Clive Dive bar or the beach. We had breakfast here one day and that was n’t even that great for the 100 we paid which is such a bummer as I love this area but highly doubt that we ’l be back to this Sheraton location.

Beautiful beachfront property and great customer service. Staff is A. Marion at the front desk was wonderful ask for her. The hotel is located right next to BlackRock. Every evening there is a ceremony where a local diver jumps off of the rock a must see experience. The beach sand is so soft and the water is clear blue. The pool has an awesome lazy river and there are two pool bars that serve snacks drinks. Part of the property is under construction but is supposed to be finished this month November 2019. The room was nicely furnished and clean. Great water pressure in the shower. Our king bed was very comfortable and the linens were soft. Will stay here again.

Wasted money on ocean view. This is our third of fourth stay at the Sheraton and was never disappointed until now. We checked in last night On our prior visits we booked the lowest catagory room and they were nice and we could even see the ocean. This time I spent more for a ocean view room and the view is not as good as the lower catagory rooms we had in the past. The room has newer furniture now but there is next to no place to put your stuff. Two small draws that just fits all you under garments socks and swim wear. One for me one for the husband. The rest you will need to hang like who wants to bother with that or you will keep in your suit case. And you will have to ask for More hangers. They have carpet in the bed area that looks worn and dirty but then I realized it was just the design of the carpet. Yuk carpet in a beach parperty. So if you want a real ocean view book ocean front or the lowest catagory room and you will do better. I just feel I wasted money and I am like to take my stuff out of the suitcase and but it was n several draws.

we have been coming to the Sheraton Maui for 20 years. it is been our go to resort on Kanapali Beach. Being on the north end of the beach it is got a quieter and more peaceful vibe than some of the flashier resorts further down the boardwalk. The service is great often outstanding and the recently remodeled rooms are very well designed and comfortable. There are many different room options here to choose from. Now that all of the beautiful room remodels are complete I hope the resort owners will continue to invest in the pool landscaping public areas. One other area for improvement is our last two rooms while upgraded have had pretty old and tired mattresses. A great bed is the foundation of a great room. Overall the Sheraton Maui delivers a consistently great guest experience. we have grown up with a lot of the staff here many who have been here 20 years. Mahalo for the great service.
